io.radar.sdk

Class Radar

  • io.radar.sdk.Radar

  • public class Radar

    The main class used to interact with the Radar SDK.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Radar INSTANCE
      The main class used to interact with the Radar SDK.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void acceptEvent(java.lang.String eventId, java.lang.String verifiedPlaceId)
      Accepts an event. Events can be accepted after user check-ins or other forms of verification. Event verifications will be used to improve the accuracy and confidence level of future events. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-verify.
      static void autocomplete(java.lang.String query, android.location.Location near, int limit, Radar.RadarGeocodeCallback callback)
      Autocompletes partial addresses and place names, sorted by relevance.

      Initializes the Radar SDK. Call this method from the main thread in your Application class before calling any other Radar methods. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-initialize.
      static void ipGeocode(Radar.RadarIpGeocodeCallback callback)
      Geocodes the device's current IP address, converting IP address to country.

      static boolean isTracking()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether tracking has been started.
      static void rejectEvent(java.lang.String eventId)
      Rejects an event. Events can be accepted after user check-ins or other forms of verification. Event verifications will be used to improve the accuracy and confidence level of future events. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-verify.
      static void reverseGeocode(Radar.RadarGeocodeCallback callback)
      Gets the device's current location, then reverse geocodes that location, converting coordinates to address.

      static void setAdIdEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Enables adId (Android advertising ID) collection.
      static void setDescription(java.lang.String description)
      Sets an optional description for the user, displayed in the dashboard.
      static void setLogLevel(Radar.RadarLogLevel level)
      Sets the log level for debug logs.
      static void setMetadata(org.json.JSONObject metadata)
      Sets an optional set of custom key-value pairs for the user.
      static void setUserId(java.lang.String userId)
      Identifies the user. Until you identify the user, Radar will automatically identify the user by deviceId (Android ID). See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-identify.
      static void startTracking(RadarTrackingOptions options)
      Starts tracking the user's location in the background. Before calling this method, the user should have granted backgroundlocation permissions for the app. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-background.
      static void stopTracking()
      Stops tracking the user's location in the background. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-background.
      static java.lang.String stringForSource(Radar.RadarLocationSource source)
      Returns a display string for a location source value.
      static void trackOnce(Radar.RadarTrackCallback callback)
      Tracks the user's location once in the foreground.

      Tracks the user's location once in the foreground.
      static void trackOnce(android.location.Location location, Radar.RadarTrackCallback callback)
      Manually updates the user's location. Note that these calls are subject to rate limits. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-manual.

      Manually updates the user's location. Note that these calls are subject to rate limits. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-manual.

    • Field Detail

      • INSTANCE

        public static Radar INSTANCE

        The main class used to interact with the Radar SDK.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(android.content.Context context,
                              java.lang.String publishableKey)

        Initializes the Radar SDK. Call this method from the main thread in your Application class before calling any other Radar methods. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-initialize.

        Parameters:
        context - The context
        publishableKey - Your publishable API key
        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-initialize

      • setUserId

        public static void setUserId(java.lang.String userId)

        Identifies the user. Until you identify the user, Radar will automatically identify the user by deviceId (Android ID). See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-identify.

        Parameters:
        userId - A stable unique ID for the user. If null, the previous userId will be cleared.
        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-identify

      • getUserId

        public static java.lang.String getUserId()

        Returns the current userId.

        Returns:
        The current userId.

      • setDescription

        public static void setDescription(java.lang.String description)

        Sets an optional description for the user, displayed in the dashboard.

        Parameters:
        description - A description for the user. If null, the previous description will be cleared.

      • getDescription

        public static java.lang.String getDescription()

        Returns the current description.

        Returns:
        The current description.

      • setMetadata

        public static void setMetadata(org.json.JSONObject metadata)

        Sets an optional set of custom key-value pairs for the user.

        Parameters:
        metadata - A set of custom key-value pairs for the user. Must have 16 or fewer keys and values of type string, boolean, or number. If null, the previous metadata will be cleared.

      • getMetadata

        public static org.json.JSONObject getMetadata()

        Returns the current metadata.

        Returns:
        The current metadata.

      • setAdIdEnabled

        public static void setAdIdEnabled(boolean enabled)

        Enables adId (Android advertising ID) collection.

        Parameters:
        enabled - A boolean indicating whether adId should be collected.

      • trackOnce

        public static void trackOnce(android.location.Location location,
                             Radar.RadarTrackCallback callback)

        Manually updates the user's location. Note that these calls are subject to rate limits. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-manual.

        Parameters:
        location - A location for the user.
        callback - An optional callback.
        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-manual

      • startTracking

        public static void startTracking(RadarTrackingOptions options)

        Starts tracking the user's location in the background. Before calling this method, the user should have granted backgroundlocation permissions for the app. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-background.

        Parameters:
        options - Configurable tracking options.
        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-background

      • stopTracking

        public static void stopTracking()

        Stops tracking the user's location in the background. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-background.

        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-background

      • isTracking

        public static boolean isTracking()

        Returns:
        The current tracking options.

      • acceptEvent

        public static void acceptEvent(java.lang.String eventId,
                               java.lang.String verifiedPlaceId)

        Accepts an event. Events can be accepted after user check-ins or other forms of verification. Event verifications will be used to improve the accuracy and confidence level of future events. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-verify.

        Parameters:
        eventId - The ID of the event to accept.
        verifiedPlaceId - For place entry events, the ID of the verified place. May be null.
        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-verify

      • rejectEvent

        public static void rejectEvent(java.lang.String eventId)

        Rejects an event. Events can be accepted after user check-ins or other forms of verification. Event verifications will be used to improve the accuracy and confidence level of future events. See https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-verify.

        Parameters:
        eventId - The ID of the event to reject.
        See Also:
        https://radar.io/documentation/sdk#android-verify

      • searchPlaces

        public static void searchPlaces(int radius,
                                java.lang.String[] chains,
                                java.lang.String[] categories,
                                java.lang.String[] groups,
                                java.lang.Integer limit,
                                Radar.RadarSearchPlacesCallback callback)

        Gets the device's current location, then searches for places near that location, sorted by distance.

        Parameters:
        radius - The radius to search, in meters. A number between 100 and 10000.
        chains - An array of chain slugs to filter. See https://radar.io/documentation/places/chains
        categories - An array of categories to filter. See https://radar.io/documentation/places/categories
        groups - An array of groups to filter. See https://radar.io/documentation/places/groups
        limit - The max number of places to return. A number between 1 and 100.
        callback - A callback.

      • searchPlaces

        public void searchPlaces(int radius,
                         java.lang.String[] chains,
                         java.lang.String[] categories,
                         java.lang.String[] groups,
                         java.lang.Integer limit,
                         kotlin.jvm.functions.Function3<? super io.radar.sdk.Radar.RadarStatus,? super android.location.Location,? super io.radar.sdk.model.RadarPlace[],kotlin.Unit> block)

        Gets the device's current location, then searches for places near that location, sorted by distance.

        Parameters:
        radius - The radius to search, in meters. A number between 100 and 10000.
        chains - An array of chain slugs to filter. See https://radar.io/documentation/places/chains
        categories - An array of categories to filter. See https://radar.io/documentation/places/categories
        groups - An array of groups to filter. See https://radar.io/documentation/places/groups
        limit - The max number of places to return. A number between 1 and 100.
        block - A block callback.

        callback - A callback.

        public static void autocomplete(java.lang.String query,
                                android.location.Location near,
                                int limit,
                                Radar.RadarGeocodeCallback callback)

        Autocompletes partial addresses and place names, sorted by relevance.

        Parameters:
        query - The partial address or place name to autocomplete.
        near - A location for the search.
        limit - The max number of addresses to return. A number between 1 and 100.
        callback - A callback.
